element.name: True Blue Mage
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Head buried in a Monster Encyclopedia, a small kobold quickly identifies the snarling beast attacking the nearby shelter as a Chimera, offering his allies valuable insight into its strengths, weaknesses before charging into battle with sword drawn.

Cornered and separated from her allies in a dark sewer a dwarf steels herself, calling upon the lore of a shadow demon to step into the darkness, emerging behind the patrol. Her grinning mouth distends delivering a fatal bite to an ooze, devouring it whole.
Her eyes light up with understanding as she unravels new secret lore.

An orc dives between the ankheg and his ally, mandibles clattering off his shield. He focuses for a moment on the multitude of monstrous essences within his mind and draws one of them out, his eyes shimmering with an unearthly glow as the monster rapidly turns to stone.
Monstrous as they may seem blue mages come in as many forms as the fascinating creatures they research.
By mastering the exotic power of blue magic they can adopt the magical abilities of monsters, turning their foes greatest strengths against them.
Blue mages approach their studies in a variety of ways, but each of them rely on the same principle - learning to alter their inner beast.

Every living being has a primal force within them that drives their base instincts - be it fight or flight, the need to sate hunger, or the gut feeling that informs your decisions - this is the beast.
By accessing the beasts within other creatures it is possible to teach your beast their tricks!
How they manipulate magic, how they alter their bodies, and shape their minds to perform the extraordinary feats that monsters are famed for.
Through the study of monsterology these bestial secrets are uncovered and recorded as Lore, which can be memorized, made part of your own beast, and expressed through your physical form.
Lore allows the blue mage to mimic just about anything a monster can do, no matter its size - the hard part is surviving long enough to learn it!
Unfortunately, blue magic is a new endeavor and as such often fraught with misunderstandings and skepticism from the arcane establishment.
It is also a double edged sword, trying to achieve what monsters can do without being labeled as a monster yourself.
These social roadblocks lead most blue mages to researching in the field, engaging with monsters up close and personal - not a task for the faint of heart but certainly a necessity.
Many will join adventuring parties simply because it gives them better odds of survival while taking notes.
The research subjects don't last very long, but better them than you!

It's only by adventuring and encountering monsters in person that the schools of monsterology can be built upon, boundaries pushed, and the study of blue magic legitimized in the eyes of academic naysayers.
Creating a blue mage character demands an unorthodox history.
How did your character discover this strange new kind of magic? How did you discover you had a talent for it?
Do you have a natural aptitude, or did you study hard and keep trying things until you found something that worked?
Did you have a run in with a monster, or a strange event that revealed the inner beast to you? What made you decide to do more than just study?
Did making contact with your inner beast change you? Does it hunger for power or perhaps encourage you to better yourself?

Do you seek a journey of self discovery, or do you want to contribute to the budding academic presence of monsterology? Perhaps you're looking for notoriety, vengeance against a monster that wronged you, or maybe you seek to become a monster yourself.

You can make a Blue Mage quickly by following these suggestions. First make Intelligence your highest ability scorescore. Second choose the Lore Master discipline. Third, choose the sage background. Lastly choose the Flumph: Limited Telepathy and Magmin: Flaming Leap lore for your research journal.
As an blue mage, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d10 per blue mage level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per blue mage level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, Medium armour
Weapons: Simple Weapons, Longswords, Scimitars, Shortswords
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Dexterity, Intelligence
Skills: Choose two from Athletics, Animal Handling, Arcana, History, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, Survival

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a scimitar, (b) a longsword, or (c) any simple weapon
(a) scale mail or (b) leather armor
(a) an explorer's pack or (b) a scholar's pack
a research journal
a dagger

description.p: A character that takes one or more levels in blue mage cannot take levels in any other class, and forfeits levels they already have in other classes.

tr.td: Blue Mage Discipline, Lore, Research Journal

element.name: Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Also at 1st level, your study of the inner beast has reached a breakthrough revealing the art of Lore - studies and insights into other creatures that allow you to manifest the features and qualities of monsters.
You memorize a list of blue mage lore from those you have available in your research journal. While memorized a lore is treated as a class feature for you, and you can make use of it as described.
To memorize lore, choose any combination of blue mage lore up to the memorization limit for your level as shown on the blue mage table. Using lore doesn't remove it from your list.

You can change your list of memorized lore when you finish a long rest. Memorizing a new list of blue mage lore requires time spent studying your research journal and meditating to commune with your inner beast: at least 5 minutes per lore.
You can work for 1 hour as part of a long rest, focusing on an essence you possess to extract knowledge from it.
Select a bestial lore that you meet the prerequisites for from an appropriate school. Your choice is added to the species' entry in your journal and the essence is lost.

You can always learn lore from the Ancestral school, however some creature types grant you access to more obscure schools of lore. Check the Schools of Monsterology table below to see if the creature's type grants you access to a specialized school.

You can only know one lore for each species at a time unless otherwise specified, however you can choose to replace a lore if you acquire essence from a member of its species again. Doing so removes the old lore from your memorized list if it is currently memorized.
*Note that you cannot learn lore from humanoids

Intelligence is the ability score used for your blue mage lore, so you use your Intelligence whenever a lore refers to your lore ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a blue mage lore and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Lore save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Lore attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

sheet.description: You can prepare {{true blue mage:spellcasting:prepare}} Learned Lore from the your Research Journal.

element.name: Bestial Die
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You gain a bestial die which is a d6. Some lore and class features will call on you to roll your bestial die, or deal 'bestial damage' in which case you roll this die. This die is not expended when used.
Your bestial die increases in size when you reach 5th level (d8), 11th Level (d10), and 17th Level (d12).

sheet.description: You have a bestial die of 1d{{blu:bestial die}}. This die is not expended when used.

element.name: Essences
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you successfully use your discipline's learning style on a creature you acquire some of its inner beast's essence. Each creautre's essence is unique, and you can hold a number of essences within yourself equal to your proficiency bonus for a number of days equal to your intelligence modifier.

As long as you carry an essence within yourself you are aware of the species and type of the creature it came from (eg. Wolf is a species of type Beast; Pixie is a species of type Fey; and Zombie is a species of type Undead etc).
If you collect a new essence while at your limit, you can replace one of the essences within you with the newly acquired essence.

sheet.description: Each creautre's essence is unique, and you can hold a number of essences within yourself equal to your proficiency bonus for a number of days equal to your intelligence modifier. As long as you carry an essence within yourself you are aware of the species and type of the creature it came from (eg. Wolf is a species of type Beast; Pixie is a species of type Fey; and Zombie is a species of type Undead etc). If you collect a new essence while at your limit, you can replace one of the essences within you with the newly acquired essence.

element.name: Blue Mage Discpline
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 1st level, you have started training in one of the blue mage disciplines of your choice: The Gourmand, Immortal Lion, or Lore Master each of which are detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 6th level, and again at 10th, 14th, and 20th level.

element.name: Research Journal
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your research journal is the repository of blue mage lore you know. When you gain this feature at 1st level you add two species of your choice from the Case Studies table below, adding their related Lore to your research journal.

sheet.description: Repository of blue mage lore you know. Memorizied Lore will appear in Spell List.

select.name: Monster Mimicry
select.supports: (Monster Mimicry Cosmic||Monster Mimicry Ancestral||Monster Mimicry Mythical||Monster Mimicry Sacred||Monster Mimicry Supernatural||Monster Mimicry Primordial)

element.name: Libra
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 2nd level, your extensive documentation on different species can be used to learn about creatures. By spending at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature, the DM reveals two of the following characteristics about it of your choice:

ul.li: Highest Ability Score
Lowest Ability Score
Special Senses
Armor Class
Current Hit Points
A random condition or damage immunity (if any)

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can't learn additional information from the same creature again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: By spending at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature, the DM reveals two of the following characteristics about it of your choice: Highest Ability Score, Lowest Ability Score, Special Senses, Armor Class, Current hit points, and a random condition or damage immunity (if any). Once you use this feature, you can't learn additional information from the same creature again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Research Specialization
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Every blue mage has their favorite monsterology schools to study, ensuring you additional insights going forward.
Select two monsterology schools as your areas of specialty.

From 3rd level, every time you gain a level in this class your research reveals one new creature of a type related to one of the schools (your DM can advise you of an appropriate creature for your level). You can add a new blank entry for that species to your research journal.

element.name: Ability Score Improvement
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

element.name: Extra Attack
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Beginning at 5th level your experience with fighting monsters has improved your overall combat skill. You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

element.name: Bestial Might
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Also at 5th level, attacks granted to you by Lore are imbued with your beast's growing power and now count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: All Lore abilities count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

element.name: Scan
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 9th level, your expertise with studying creatures makes identifying traits almost second nature.
• Libra can now be used as an action
• You learn three characteristics instead of two
Additionally, you can now choose from the following characteristics to learn about the creature:
• Condition immunities
• Damage resistances
• Damage vulnerabilities
• Damage immunities
• Is Legendary? (Can use legendary resistance or legendary actions)

sheet.description: You can use Libra as an action. You will learn three characteristics. Additionally you can learn about: Condition immunities, Damage resistances, immunities or vulnerabilities, Is Legendary

element.name: Legendary Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 11th level your education and training have prepared your inner beast to wield the power of legendary lore.

If you are able to find and successfully use your learning style on a creature that you have identified as a legendary creature, you may select a legendary lore from its related school in place of bestial lore.
You can only memorize one legendary lore at a time as part of your memorized lore list, but you can memorize an additional legendary lore at 13th, 15th, and 17th level.

element.name: Immortal Lion
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: The immortal lions are a secretive group of Blue Mages from a long forgotten empire that mastered the dark art of binding essences together. By using forbidden alchemy, they can capture a portion of the inner beast and bind its essence to their own.
However keeping their beast in control of so many warring essences is a constant struggle that many immortals succumb to, becoming naught but monsters themselves.

element.name: Sentinel Proficiencies
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you choose this discipline at 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons, heavy armor, shields and alchemist's supplies.

sheet.decsription: You gain proficiency with martial weapons, heavy armor, shields and alchemist's supplies.

element.name: Fearless Intercept
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by 1d10 + your Constitution modifier (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or weapon, or possess a natural weapon to use this reaction.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you reduce the damage the target takes by 1d10 + {{fearless intercept}}. You must be wielding a shield or weapon, or possess a natural weapon to use this reaction.

When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you reduce the damage the target takes by 2d10 + {{fearless intercept}}. You must be wielding a shield or weapon, or possess a natural weapon to use this reaction.

element.name: Siphon Essence
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you use fearless intercept, you can make use of the momentary opening to siphon essence from the attacking creature. You can siphon essence a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you use fearless intercept, you can make use of the momentary opening to siphon essence from the attacking creature.

element.name: Urhgan Defense
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You are trained in Aht Urhganian military techniques. Once per turn, when you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks to focus on defensive positioning and parrying blows. You gain a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn while you wield a weapon or possess a natural weapon, and aren't incapacitated.

sheet.description: You gain a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn while you wield a weapon or possess a natural weapon, and aren't incapacitated.

element.name: Collective Memory
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 6th level you can borrow the knowledge and skills of the many essences within you. When you finish a short or long rest, you can choose one skill or tool proficiency that you lack and gain it. Your proficiency lasts until you use this feature to select a different proficiency.

sheet.description: When you finish a short or long rest, you can choose one skill or tool proficiency.

element.name: Immortal Strength
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: By 10th level, you can draw on the strength of your essencesto block your foes attacks. When you use Fearless Intercept, you now reduce the damage by 2d10 + your Constitution modifier instead.

sheet.description: When you use Fearless Intercept, you have resistance to any damage your are forced to take, and you have advantage on your first saving throw to stave off any condition you are forced to accept.

element.name: Soul Shuffle
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: From 14th level, you are able to express greater control over the essences within. You can meditate for 10 minutes during a short rest to change the lore you have memorized. You can change a number of lore equal to your half your proficiency bonus rounded down.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can meditate for 10 minutes during a short rest to change a number of lore you have memorized equal to half of your proficiency bonus rounded down.

element.name: We Are Legion
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 20th level, you are able to tap into the many monstrous essences within you to alter your mind and body.
When you finish a long rest, as part of your daily memorization and meditation, you may subtract up to 4 points from amongst your ability scores and redistribute them.
You may raise an ability score above 20 this way, and the adjustment lasts until you finish your next long rest.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest, subtract up to 4 points from amongst your ability scores and redistribute them. You may raise an ability score above 20 this way,

element.name: Gourmand
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: If there's one thing every being has in common with their inner beast it's the hunger, the compulsion that drives living beings to survive. Gourmands can use this link as a way to reach their beast, gifting it the essence of other beasts. Whether it's to fight their way to the top of the food chain, or simply discover every taste the world has to offer, you work with your beast to become what you eat.

element.name: Culinarian Proficiencies
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you choose this discipline at first level, you gain proficiency with tridents, and cook's utensils.

element.name: Learning Style
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Also at 1st level you have discovered how to acquire essence from the creatures of the world. The gourmand achieves this by feeding their inner beast and digesting the essence of others. You gain the following feature:

Devour. When a creature is slain within range of your movement, you can use your reaction to move to a square adjacent to it and channel your inner beast to consume it through you. If the creature is Medium sized or smaller you may devour it whole, otherwise if the creature is larger it can be badly maimed instead, losing a limb or similar sized portion of its body. If some or all of the creature was devoured, you acquire the creature's essence.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature is slain within range of your movement, you can use your reaction to move to a square adjacent to it and channel your inner beast to consume it through you. If the creature is Medium sized or smaller you may devour it whole, otherwise if the creature is larger it can be badly maimed instead, losing a limb or similar sized portion of its body. If some or all of the creature was devoured, you acquire the creature's essence.

When a creature is slain within range of your movement, you can use your reaction to move to a square adjacent to it and channel your inner beast to consume it through you. If the creature is Larger sized or smaller you may devour it whole, and consume up to a similarly sized portion of larger creatures. If some or all of the creature was devoured, you acquire the creature's essence.

element.name: Bestial Bite
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Lastly, at 1st level your inner beast can manifest through you to strike at a foe. When you use your action to invoke a lore or take the attack action, you can use your bonus action to make a melee lore attack against a creautre within 5 feet of you, dealing 1d4 piercing damage plus your Intelligence modifier on a hit.

sheet.description: When you use your action to invoke a lore or take the attack action, you can use your bonus action to make a melee lore attack against a creautre within 5 feet of you, dealing 1d4 piercing damage plus {{intelligence:modifier}} on a hit.

When you use your action to invoke a lore or take the attack action, you can use your bonus action to make a melee lore attack against a creautre within 5 feet of you, dealing 1d6 piercing damage plus {{intelligence:modifier}} on a hit.

element.name: Sophisticated Palette
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 6th level, your love of food has refined the precision of your taste buds and olfactory organs, granting you advantage on Intelligence(Perception) and (Investigation) checks related to taste and smell.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Intelligence(Perception) and (Investigation) checks related to taste and smell.

element.name: Dire Maw
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: By 10th level your body is growing stronger from the accumulated essence within, allowing your inner beast act through it to perform more viscious acts. Your Bestial Bite attack's damage improves to 1d6 piercing damage. Additionally you may now devour creatures that are Large or smaller whole, and consume up to a similarly sized portion of larger creatures.

element.name: Reinvigorate
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: From 14th level, the adrenaline rush of recognizing prey renews your hunger. When your blood in the water trait is triggered, you can refresh the use of one exhausted memorized lore that refreshes on a short or long rest.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When your devour feature is triggered, you can refresh the use of one exhausted memorized lore that refreshes on a short or long rest.

element.name: Apex Predator
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 20th level, your inner beast is more easily able to manifest through you to consume creatures. You can now devour Large or smaller creatures whole, killing them instantly. When you do so, you also restore a number of hit points equal to your level.

sheet.description: You can now devour Large or smaller creatures whole, killing them instantly. When you do so, you also restore a number of hit points equal to your level ({{level}}).

element.name: Lore Master
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: While most blue mages enjoy the rush of facing their foes up close and personal, the lore master knows a better way. Through careful observation, reading, and analysis it is possible to gain an unprecedented understanding of the inner beast with none of the undignified quarreling. While they might not learn lore as quickly as others, they are able to draw extra benefits from the lore discover.

element.name: Arcane Azure
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you choose this discipline at 1st level, you learn two cantrips from the wizard spell list, your spellcasting ability for these cantrips is Intelligence.

sheet.description: You learn two cantrips from the wizard spell list, your spellcasting ability for these cantrips is Intelligence.

element.name: Learning Style
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Also at 1st level you have discovered how to acquire essence from the creatures of the world. Lore master's accomplish this by studying creatures rather than by fighting them. You gain the following features:

Case Study. When you use your action to invoke a lore or take the attack action, you may use Libra as a bonus action to make a quick assessment of a creature within 60 feet of you. When used this way, Libra grants you only one characteristic instead of three and if the target is a non-humanoid creature you extract its essence.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you use your action to invoke a lore or take the attack action, you may use Libra as a bonus action to make a quick assessment of a creature within 60 feet of you. When used this way, Libra grants you only one characteristic instead of three and if the target is a non-humanoid creature you extract its essence.

element.name: Monstrous Cunning
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Lastly at 1st level, your study of lore and how monsters fight allows you to weave cunning and strategy into your fighting style. Once per turn when you use your action to invoke a lore, or hit a creature with a weapon attack granted by your lore, you can impose one of the following effects:

ul.li: Add your intelligence modifier to the damage roll against one target.
Force the target to make a Strength save against your Lore save DC. On a failed save they are moved up to 10 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.
Move yourself 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice, without provoking attacks of opportunity.

sheet.description: Once per turn when you use your action to invoke a lore, or hit a creature with a weapon attack granted by your lore, you can impose one of the following effects: • Add your intelligence modifier to the damage roll against one target. • Force the target to make a Strength save against your Lore save DC. On a failed save they are moved up to 10 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice. • Move yourself 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice, without provoking attacks of opportunity.

element.name: Spellsense
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 6th level, you have an uncanny sense for magic that grants you the following benefits:

ul.li: You can cast detect magic at will, without spending a spell slot.

description.p: When you use libra, you can now choose from the following characteristics to learn about the creature:

ul.li: Is Spellcaster? (Has the innate spellcasting, or spellcasting trait)

sheet.description: You can cast detect magic at will without expending a spell slot. When you use libra, you can now choose from the following characteristics to learn about the creature: "Is Spellcaster? (Has the innate spellcasting, or spellcasting trait)"

element.name: Essence Field
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: By 10th level, your mastery of lore manifesting techniques allows you to harness essence that is typically wasted when you invoke the powers of the inner beast. When you invoke a lore, you may gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier plus half your Blue Mage level, rounded up.
You can gain this benefit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you invoke a lore, you may gain {{blu:essence field}} temporary hit points.

element.name: Extrapolate Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: By 14th level, you are able to garner additional insights into the studies you complete. When you study the beast with 5 field notes and roll a success you learn a second lore for the creature's species. Each lore is treated individually for the purposes of memorization and replacement.

sheet.description: When you study the beast with 5 field notes and roll a success you learn a second lore for the creature's species. Each lore is treated individually for the purposes of memorization and replacement.

element.name: Knowledge is Power
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: At 20th level, your insights into creatures and study of them can be shared with those around you. When you use your action to study a creature using Libra, you grant allied creatures within 30 feet of you advantage on their next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check that involves the target creature.

sheet.description: When you use your action to study a creature using Libra, you grant allied creatures within 30 feet of you advantage on their next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check that involves the target creature.
